headline: AI & Business Newsletter |Will AI Really Kill Software?
summary: Imagine being a CEO who can simply tell an AI bot how to handle your company’s human-resource, sales, customer tracking and other back-office functions.  Would you still pay a software vendor millions of dollars a year for those services?  The tool is designed to make it easier for workers who aren’t software engineers to use the company’s Claude Code chatbot to automate work functions, like reviewing emails and organizing computer files.

headline: Netflix amends WBD bid, ServiceNow's OpenAI deal, 3M earnings
summary: Julie Hyman and Yahoo Finance Markets and Data Editor Jared Blikre examine some of Tuesday's trending stocks, including deal updates from Netflix (NFLX) and Warner Bros. Discovery (WBD), and OpenAI (OPAI.PVT) and ServiceNow (NOW). They also look at 3M (MMM), which reported earnings. Watch the video above to learn why investors are focused on the three tickers. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief.

headline: Gauge Capital Announces Strategic Growth Investment in Ecosystems
summary: Gauge Capital ("Gauge") announced that it has partnered with the founders and management team of Ecosystems (the "Company") to provide growth capital and recapitalize the Company. Founded in 2010, Ecosystems pioneered the Customer Value Management (CVM) category and now supports the go-to-market success of world-class B2B leaders, including HP, ServiceNow, Atlassian, and Appian.

headline: ServiceNow shares rise after WSJ reports three-year AI deal with OpenAI
summary: Investing.com -- ServiceNow shares have risen more than 2 percent in premarket trading on Tuesday after the Wall Street Journal reported that the company has signed a three-year agreement with OpenAI to embed the ChatGPT-maker’s artificial intelligence models directly into its business-software platform.

raw.headline: ServiceNow shares rise after WSJ reports three-year AI deal with OpenAI
